article.title: Home
article.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2019}} {{short description|content-addressable, peer-to-peer hypermedia distribution protocol}} {{Technical|date=May 2016}} {{Infobox software | name = InterPlanetary File System | logo = Ipfs-logo-1024-ice-text.png | logo alt = | logo caption = | screenshot = | screenshot alt = | caption = | collapsible = | author = [[Juan Benet (computer scientist)|Juan Benet]] and [[Protocol Labs]] | developer = [https://protocol.ai/ Protocol Labs] | released = | discontinued = | ver layout = | latest release version = 0.4.19 | latest release date = {{Start date and age|2019|03|01|df=yes}} | latest preview version = | latest preview date = | repo = {{URL|https://github.com/ipfs/ipfs}} | status = Active | programming language = '''Protocol implementations''': [[Go (programming language)|Go]] (reference implementation), [[JavaScript]], [[C (programming language)|C]],{{cite web|url=https://github.com/Agorise/c-ipfs|title=c-ipfs: IPFS implementation in C. Why C? Think Bitshares' Stealth backups, OpenWrt routers (decentralize the internet/meshnet!), Android TV, decentralized Media, decentralized websites, decent..|first=|last=Agorise|date=23 October 2017|website=Github.com|accessdate=25 October 2017}} [[Python (programming language)|Python]]
'''Client libraries''': Go, [[Java (programming language)|Java]], JavaScript, Python, Scala, Haskell, Swift, Common Lisp, Rust, Ruby, PHP, C#, Erlang | operating system = [[FreeBSD]], [[Linux]], [[macOS]], [[Windows]] | platform = | size = | language = [[Go (programming language)|Go]], [[JavaScript]], [[Python (programming language)|Python]] | language count = | language footnote = | genre = [[Communications protocol|Protocol]], [[distributed file system]], [[content delivery network]] | license = [[MIT license]] | alexa = | website = {{URL|https://ipfs.io/|ipfs.io}} | standard = | AsOf = }} {{File sharing sidebar}} '''InterPlanetary File System''' ('''IPFS''') is a [[Communications protocol|protocol]] and network designed to create a [[content-addressable storage|content-addressable]], [[peer-to-peer]] method of storing and sharing [[hypermedia]] in a [[distributed file system]].{{Cite web|url=https://www.wired.com/2016/06/inventors-internet-trying-build-truly-permanent-web/|title=The Inventors of the Internet Are Trying to Build a Truly Permanent Web|last=Finley|first=Klint|date=20 June 2016|work=[[Wired (magazine)|Wired]]}} IPFS is a peer-to-peer distributed file system that seeks to connect all computing devices with the same system of files. IPFS could be seen as a single [[BitTorrent]] swarm, exchanging objects within one [[Git (software)|Git]] repository. In other words, IPFS provides a high-throughput, content-addressed [[block storage]] model, with content-addressed [[hyperlink]]s.{{cite web|url=http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/juan-benet-ipfs-talks-about-filecoin-1586122|title=Juan Benet of IPFS talks about Filecoin|first=Ian|last=Allison|date=13 October 2016|website=Ibtimes.co.uk|accessdate=25 October 2017}} The filesystem can be accessed in a variety of ways, including via [[Filesystem in Userspace|FUSE]] and over [[HTTP]]. [[File:Wikipedia-logo-v2.svg|thumb|The Wikipedia logo has an IPFS hash with the following code: QmRW3V9znzFW9M5FYbitSEvd5dQrPWGvPvgQD6LM22Tv8D. It can be accessed with that hash over HTTP by a [https://ipfs.io/ipfs/QmRW3V9znzFW9M5FYbitSEvd5dQrPWGvPvgQD6LM22Tv8D public gateway] or a [http://127.0.0.1:8080/ipfs/QmRW3V9znzFW9M5FYbitSEvd5dQrPWGvPvgQD6LM22Tv8D local IPFS instance] ]] == Notable users == * The [[Catalan independence referendum, 2017|Catalan independence referendum]], taking place in September–October 2017, was deemed illegal by the [[Constitutional Court of Spain]] and many related websites were blocked. Subsequently, the Catalan Pirate Party mirrored the website on IPFS to bypass the [[High Court of Justice of Catalonia]] order of blocking.{{Cite web|url=http://www.eurekastreet.com.au/article.aspx?aeid=54133|title=Inside Catalonia's cypherpunk referendum|last=Balcell|first=Marta Poblet|date=5 October 2017|website=Eureka Street}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.neowin.net/news/catalan-referendum-app-removed-from-google-play-store|title=Catalan referendum app removed from Google Play Store|last=Hill|first=Paul|date=30 September 2017|work=Neowin|access-date=6 October 2017|language=en}} * IPFS was used to create a mirror of Wikipedia, which allows people living in jurisdictions where Wikipedia is blocked to access the content of Wikipedia.{{cite news|last1=Dale|first1=Brady|title=Turkey Can’t Block This Copy of Wikipedia|url=http://observer.com/2017/05/turkey-wikipedia-ipfs/|accessdate=20 December 2017|publisher=Observer Media|date=10 May 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171018092720/http://observer.com/2017/05/turkey-wikipedia-ipfs/|archivedate=18 October 2017}} That archived version of Wikipedia is a limited immutable copy that cannot be updated. * [[Filecoin]], also inter-related to IPFS and developed by [[Juan Benet (computer scientist)|Juan Benet]] and [[Protocol Labs]], is an IPFS-based [[cooperative storage cloud]].{{Cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/16/magazine/beyond-the-bitcoin-bubble.html |title=Beyond the Bitcoin Bubble |last=Johnson |first=Steven |date=16 January 2018 |work=The New York Times |access-date=26 September 2018 |language=en}} * In September 2018, [[Cloudflare]] launched an IPFS gateway{{Cite web|url=https://blog.cloudflare.com/distributed-web-gateway/|title=Cloudflare goes InterPlanetary - Introducing Cloudflare’s IPFS Gateway|date=17 September 2018|website=The Cloudflare Blog|language=en|access-date=24 January 2019}}, as well as an IPFS-backed version of their services.{{Cite web|url=https://blog.cloudflare.com/e2e-integrity/|title=End-to-End Integrity with IPFS|date=17 September 2018|website=The Cloudflare Blog|language=en|access-date=24 January 2019}}. The gateway permits https read access to most types of files located within IPFS (but e.g. not to streaming video files). == References == {{reflist|colwidth=30em}} == External links == * {{Official website|https://ipfs.io/}}, IPFS.io {{File systems|state=collapsed}} {{File sharing|state=collapsed}} {{Internet censorship circumvention technologies|state=collapsed}} {{Cryptocurrencies|state=collapsed}} [[Category:Application layer protocols]] [[Category:Computer-related introductions in 2015]] [[Category:Distributed data storage]] [[Category:Distributed file systems]] [[Category:File transfer protocols]] [[Category:Free network-related software]] [[Category:Free software programmed in Python]] [[Category:Internet privacy software]] [[Category:Internet protocols]] [[Category:Network protocols]] [[Category:Peer-to-peer computing]] [[Category:World Wide Web]]
